snippet: A state constitutional amendment places improper burdens on racial minorities.
abstract: Editorial urges Supreme Court, in case Schuette v Coalition to Defend Affirmative Action, to uphold lower court's decision and strike down 2006 amendment to Michigan's state constitution that bans any consideration of race or sex in public education; holds case in another reminder of the threat to minority rights posed by ballot initiatives.
lead_paragraph: A state constitutional amendment places improper burdens on racial minorities.
